description: From Old English wābegān (“beset by woe”), from wā (“woe”) + begān (“to beset, to surround”). Equivalent to woe +‎ begone (past participle of bego).

adjectives.description: woebegone (comparative more woebegone, superlative most woebegone)

examples: Synonyms: dilapidated, derelict, godforsaken, ramshackle, rundown, tumbledown

entries.meaning: Filled with or deeply affected by woe.
examples: Synonyms: sad, lamentable; see also Thesaurus:sad
